      • timeStamp

        public static java.lang.String timeStamp(java.util.Calendar date,
                                         java.lang.String separator)
        Given a date, a timestamp string is generated. It is useful to name data files.
        Parameters:
        date - date to be used
        separator - a string to be inserted between the values
        Returns:
        A string such as "20100922203245" containing from year to seconds

      • timeStamp

        public static java.lang.String timeStamp(java.lang.String separator)
        Gives a timestamp string using the present date. It is useful to name data files.
        Parameters:
        separator - a string to be inserted between the values
        Returns:
        A string such as "20100922203245" containing from year to seconds

      • timeStamp

        public static java.lang.String timeStamp()
        Gives a timestamp string using the present date. It is useful to name data files.
        Returns:
        A string such as "20100922203245" containing from year to seconds

                               int begin,

                               char c)
        Check the presence of a char in an array
        Parameters:
        array - array of char under investigation
        begin - initial position
        end - final position
        c - the char under investigation
        Returns:
        true if c is in the specific range of the array

      • getTags

        public static java.lang.String[] getTags(java.lang.String line)
        Get all the tags, separated by spaces, in a string. Spaces are removed. The text after a // is considered a comment.
        Parameters:
        line - the string to be analyzed
        Returns:
        a array of strings with the tags

      • putLongIn

        public static java.lang.String putLongIn(long number,
                                         int begin,
                                         int end,
                                         java.lang.String orig)
        Allows to overwrite a numeric value on a given string. The number will be right aligned if the number of digits is smaller than the size of the field.
        Parameters:
        number - the numeric value
        begin - initial position to putLongIn the number
        end - final position to putLongIn the number
        orig - original string
        Returns:
        a new string containing the number

      • convertToNum

        public static int convertToNum(char c)
        Converts the digit in its equivalent numeric value. The character '0' is the base value. Therefore its value is zero.
        Parameters:
        c - the character
        Returns:
        the numeric value

      • getLongFrom

        public static long getLongFrom(int begin,
                               int end,
                               java.lang.String text)
        Allows to get a integer value from a field inside a string
        Parameters:
        begin - initial position
        end - final position
        text - the string
        Returns:
        the numeric value

      • convertToDouble

        public static java.lang.Double convertToDouble(java.lang.String string,
                                               java.lang.Double min,
                                               java.lang.Double max,
                                               java.lang.Double other)
        Converts a string in a numeric value. The result is confined in a range. If the string does not contain a valid number, a default value is returned. It is useful when you are reading a string from a form or a field in a front end.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to be converted
        min - the minimum valid value
        max - the maximum valid value
        other - a default value to be returned whether the string is not a number
        Returns:
        a numeric value

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Double num,
                                      int size,
                                      char fill)
        Returns a string containing a right-aligned integer value. The places at left of the number is filled with a declared char
        Parameters:
        num - the numeric value
        size - the size of the numeric field to be created
        fill - the char to be used at left
        Returns:
        a string with a right-aligned number

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Double num,
                                      int size,
                                      int dec,
                                      char fill)
        Returns a string containing a right-aligned value. The places at left of the number is filled with a declared char
        Parameters:
        num - the numeric value
        size - the size of the numeric field to be created
        dec - number of decimal places
        fill - the char to be used at left
        Returns:
        a string with a right-aligned number

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Double num,
                                      int size)
        Returns a string containing a right-aligned value. The places at left of the number is filled with spaces
        Parameters:
        num - the numeric value
        size - the size of the numeric field to be created
        Returns:
        a string with a right-aligned number

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Double num,
                                      int size,
                                      int dec)
        Returns a string containing a right-aligned value. The places at left of the number is filled with spaces
        Parameters:
        num - the numeric value
        size - the size of the numeric field to be created
        dec - number of decimal places (minimum = 1)
        Returns:
        a string containing the number

      • equivalent

        public static boolean equivalent(java.lang.String x,
                                 java.lang.String y,
                                 char wild)
        Check if two strings are equivalent. Equivalence means: the same size, the same characters (case sensitive). The position contained the defined wildcard are ignored.
        Parameters:
        x - a string
        y - another string
        wild - wildcard character
        Returns:
        true if x and y are equivalent
